availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Franklin McGill (Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel McGill and Elizabeth Earl McGill. Married to Sarah E. Mullins McGill in Falmouth, Kentucky, on December 22, 1857. Father of William S. McGill, Sallie B. McGill, Charles F. McGill, and Lizzie McGill. Farmer in Bracken County in 1850. Farmer in Bracken County in 1860. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1863. Operated grocery retail space in George S. Kimberly's building in Foster, Kentucky, from December 12, 1862 to February 15, 1863.
